page.title: 16ECOLOGY IN CRANHAM
page.content: The Upminster-Cranham area covers both urban and rural environments. With open{COUNTRYSIDE}to the North, East and South and much farmland nearby Upminster's low density housing plays host to a wide variety of fauna and flora.Housing areas host Sparrows, Starlings,Thrushes,Blackbirds and Magpies. The Brickfields Park in Cranham includes areas of woodland,grassland, bush and shrub vegetation.The open grassland is host to a wide range of {BUTTERFLIES}including Small Heath, Small Copper,Common Blue and the Essex Skipper. There are several local authority {COUNTRY PARKS}just outside Upminster that are frequently visited at weekends.These include South Weald and Belhus Parks.The latter is well known for it's Bluebell Walks and insects.
